summary: This document is a set of court records from Palm Beach County, Florida, related to the criminal case against Jeffrey E Epstein. It includes the information (charging document) for procuring a person under 18 for prostitution, booking records from two arrests, a judgment withholding adjudication, a sentence order, a plea agreement detailing a negotiated settlement, and extensive conditions of community control and sex offender registration requirements. The records show Epstein was charged, pleaded guilty/nolo contendere, received a sentence including jail time and community control, and was designated a sex offender.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant charged with procuring a person under 18 for prostitution and felony solicitation of prostitution. The documents detail his arrests, plea, sentencing, and sex offender registration requirements.

persons.name: Barry E. Krischer
persons.context: The State Attorney for the Fifteenth Judicial Circuit who filed the criminal information charging Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Sandra K. McSorley
persons.context: The judge who signed the order for conditions of community control/supervision for Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Krischer, as State Attorney, filed the criminal information formally charging Epstein with the crimes.
Judge McSorley presided over the sentencing phase, signing the order imposing conditions of community control and supervision on Epstein.

events.title: First Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and booked under booking number 2006036744. The charge listed is 'Procure Person Under Age of 18 for Prostitution' with a 'No Bond' status.

events.title: Second Arrest / Self-Surrender of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein self-surrendered and was booked under warrant/case number 2008039316. Charges included 'Prostitution-Offer Commit Engage 3rd Person' and 'Felony Solicitation of Prostitution' related to a sealed indictment.

events.title: Filing of Criminal Information
events.description: The State Attorney filed a formal criminal information charging Jeffrey Epstein with knowingly procuring a person under 18 for prostitution between August 1, 2004, and October 9, 2005.

events.title: Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Epstein entered a plea (guilty/nolo contendere) and was sentenced. The negotiated settlement resulted in a 12-month jail sentence, a consecutive 6-month jail sentence, and 12 months of community control with strict sex offender conditions. Adjudication of guilt was withheld.

locations: West Palm Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida
205 N Dixie Hwy, West Palm Beach, FL 33480 (listed as an address for Epstein)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was formally charged with procuring a person under the age of 18 for prostitution, a second-degree felony, for acts alleged to have occurred between August 1, 2004, and October 9, 2005.

Epstein's 2008 plea deal resulted in a sentence of 18 months total incarceration (12 months + 6 months consecutive) in the Palm Beach County Detention Facility, followed by 12 months of community control with strict conditions, including no unsupervised contact with minors.
The court documents designate Jeffrey Epstein as a 'Sexual Offender' pursuant to Florida Statute 943.0435, triggering lifelong registration and reporting requirements.

The conditions of Epstein's community control were exceptionally detailed and restrictive, including electronic monitoring, mandatory curfew, sex offender treatment, polygraph exams, warrantless searches, and prohibitions on living near places children congregate.
The records reference a 'sealed indictment' from July 2008, indicating federal involvement or a separate set of charges that were not publicly disclosed at the time of this state court proceeding.
